data.title: Best Salvadoran food in town!
data.text: Looking to try some delicious Salvadoran food? This is the place to go to. They have a variety to choose from!

data.title: Great pupusas
data.text: Nice staff/owners and good Salvadorean food. Nowhere else in this area to get authentic Salvadoran cuisine. They serve red beans which I love having lived in Honduras where they also cook with red beans. The encurtido is good and the only bummer was that they were out of pastelitos de carne which are my favorite. I would eat those by the dozen. Many more plates I would like to try there. The restaurant itself is pretty basic and not fancy but you're there for the food so no biggie.

data.title: Mixed bag...
data.text:
I was very excited to try this place.  The family that works there/owns it/runs it is very nice.  I enjoyed reading about their story in the newspaper clipping on the wall and the etymology of the word "pupusa."  I also was entertained by the bathroom signs.  HOWEVER, I concur with Martin C, this place is pricier than most Salvadorean places, and I was seriously disenchanted to wait for over 30minutes to get a takeout order.  By the time I got my food, a whole bunch of other people had gotten theirs (yes they might be regulars and close personal friends because it did have that vibe but I was hungry) and I was actually pretty upset- to the point I will not go back.  

The food: In first place are the plantains- seriously delicious, though I did not like the funky crema (smells and tastes a little too much like processed cheese dip for my taste).  It is tempting to go back for those, but I think I will be OK.

In second place is the pupusa revuelta (stuffed pupusa).  My roommate, who had never had Salvadorean food before, liked the filled pupusa.  I thought they were good but kind of expensive compared to the last place I had pupusas (still in California).

The dish I would not bother getting again was the Plato Salvadoreno tipico (thin sliced beef steak with salad, rice and beans with non-filled pupusa on the side.  Really seemed like nothing special.

data.title: Good Pupusas
data.text: Don't be fooled by the questionable exterior of the restaurant. The inside is clean and the food is good. Have tried a few different dishes and by far the pupusas are the best. They also have a really good "aguas frescas". The service can be a bit slow because they get busy and the pupusas are made to order. Well worth the wait because you get freshly cooked food.

data.title: My family and I enjoyed this restaurant
data.text:
Nothing is perfect, but this restaurant is very good. I haven't had a bad experience yet. Las pupusas are of good quality, the breakfasts are right on the money, the stakes plates are delicious, and the yuca is as good as I expected. Of course there are some areas that might not be as perfect as we would like to, but most of the food is very good and a fair price. Las empanadas were very good too. 
The staff is very nice and kind, no matter how busy they are. I recommend this restaurant if you would like to enjoy Salvadorean Food. Very good!

data.title: Overpriced Salvadorian Food
data.text: This place is located off Broadway St. in a run downed strip mall.   The owners are quite friendly and the food is typical Salvadorian fare. The problem with this place is that the food is way overpriced for what it is- mainly thick tortillas lightly stuffed with either pork or cheese and squash. A typical "Papusa" plate runs an average of $8.90. Some of the other dishes such as carne asada run about $14.00. My wife wanted to order the caldo de pollo (chicken soup) which was an outrageous $9.90. Thankfully they didn't have it the day we visited Las Comadres.   I would characterize Salvadorian food in the same realm as Mexican food except a typical Mexican restaurant would be a much better value in comparison. I would not go back to Las Comadres as the value proposition is just not there for me.

data.title: Great Salvadorian food!
data.text:
I actually would rate this at 4.5...
Came here last night craving papusas. We live in SF in the Mission District, so we have plenty of Salvadorian restaurants in our hood. We also have a friend from El Salvador whose mother makes homemade papusas, casamiento, etc. Having said that, we feel Las Comadres' papusas compared VERY favorably against the others. Perfectly cooked and great ingredients - yummy! My wife's beans were a little thin, and I prefer my casamiento more fried, but they were delicious even so. The staff were friendly and cheerful. And for those who felt the decor was funky, this is totally normal for authentic Salvadorian restaurants. We can absolutely recommend this place if you want great authentic food!

data.title: What am I missing?
data.text: Went here due to the high ranking....wow, was I disappointed.  Seriously one of the worse meals I have ever had....maybe I just don't like Salvadorean food.  Atmosphere ok, smell of facility not good, presentation weird, plastic plates.  Just unfortunately not a good experience for all of us.  I had a chicken tamale which had 90% tamale outside, one small piece of chicken and a very small slice of green pepper.  No sauce, no flavor.   Kids had rice and beans and beans look like they came out of a blender and were totally fluid.  The sandwich my wife had looked good and was decent, but overall the meal was way below my 4.5 star expectation.  Again, maybe it's just Salvadorian food, but I was unimpressed and not satisfied at all with the meal.

data.title: PUPUSAS!
data.text:
very friendly staff - we didn't know what kind of pupusas to get so we took the advice of the waitress and the pupusas were delish!

Horchata and Ensalada drinks - yummy.

It's a local dive that I have driven by a hundred times and never noticed.  Went on the recommendation of a friend.

data.title: Very authentic
data.text:
We love their pupusas! Everything is just like mom made it or as if we were in El Salvador. Believe me I've eaten this food for years. I have been to El Salvador and eaten at other Salvadoran restaurants here in the states and this place is great!!
You may want to do a little research prior so you know what to try.
